match.title: 6th Match
match.statusText: Bangladesh won by 5 wickets (with 17 balls remaining) (D/L method)

series.name: Asia Cup
series.description: Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka in Bangladesh

image.caption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium
image.longCaption: Fans enjoy a domestic Twenty20 match at the Shere-Bangla Stadium, Mirpur, October 15, 2009

match.hoursInfo: 14.00 start, First Session 14.00-17.30, Interval 17.30-18.15, Second Session 18.15-21.45

dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Kapugedera c Shakib Al Hasan b Abdur Razzak 62 (92b 4x4 0x6 138m) SR: 67.39

dismissalComment.html: sharp catch from Shakib, Kapu cannot believe it, he had smashed this full delivery inside-out but it carried low to Shakib at extra cover, the former captain goes low to hold on

headshotImage.caption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shahadat Hossain 48 (44b 5x4 1x6 60m) SR: 109.09

dismissalComment.html: important strike, Tharanga goes caught behind, to a full away swinging delivery just outside off, Tharanga bent across, tried to run it away but only managed a thick edge to Rahim

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: he's bowled 'em, what a strike early on for Bangladesh, Mahela is gone with a nothing stroke, length delivery outside off stump, angled in a shade, Mahela leaves a big gap between bat and pad as he ends up wafting tentatively across the line, the ball sneaks through and takes out off

oh dear, Sanga has smacked a pitched up delivery straight to extra cover, nothing much in the delivery, it was widish and slanted across Sanga, who got forward and thumped it straight to the fielder, Bangladesh celebrate with glee, Sanga walks off quickly

oh boy, Nazmul is all over the Sri Lankans, this time Dilshan has played on, he had become a touch wary after those two big wickets, but that is just not his game, this time he tries to force a length ball through the off side, with no foot movement, the ball was not wide enough, and he ends up getting an inside edge on to the stumps, some start for Bangladesh

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: unfortunate, how unfortunate is that for Thirimanne, he has been stumped off Rahim's pads, he missed the nudge as this one went down the leg side, it all happened so quickly that Rahim was in no position to collect the ball, it rolled onto the stumps off his pad with Thirimanne's momentum having taken him outside the crease, Bangladesh breaking through before the batting Powerplay

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: sharp catch from Shakib, Kapu cannot believe it, he had smashed this full delivery inside-out but it carried low to Shakib at extra cover, the former captain goes low to hold on

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Nazmul Hossain 5 (12b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 41.66

dismissalComment.html: he's bowled 'em, what a strike early on for Bangladesh, Mahela is gone with a nothing stroke, length delivery outside off stump, angled in a shade, Mahela leaves a big gap between bat and pad as he ends up wafting tentatively across the line, the ball sneaks through and takes out off

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Nazimuddin b Nazmul Hossain 6 (14b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: oh dear, Sanga has smacked a pitched up delivery straight to extra cover, nothing much in the delivery, it was widish and slanted across Sanga, who got forward and thumped it straight to the fielder, Bangladesh celebrate with glee, Sanga walks off quickly

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Nazmul Hossain 19 (22b 3x4 0x6 43m) SR: 86.36

dismissalComment.html: oh boy, Nazmul is all over the Sri Lankans, this time Dilshan has played on, he had become a touch wary after those two big wickets, but that is just not his game, this time he tries to force a length ball through the off side, with no foot movement, the ball was not wide enough, and he ends up getting an inside edge on to the stumps, some start for Bangladesh

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Abdur Razzak 48 (73b 3x4 0x6 89m) SR: 65.75

dismissalComment.html: unfortunate, how unfortunate is that for Thirimanne, he has been stumped off Rahim's pads, he missed the nudge as this one went down the leg side, it all happened so quickly that Rahim was in no position to collect the ball, it rolled onto the stumps off his pad with Thirimanne's momentum having taken him outside the crease, Bangladesh breaking through before the batting Powerplay

dismissalText.long: c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Farveez Maharoof c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Shakib strikes, Maharoof going for the cut to a tossed up ball that straightened and skidded, gets an edge through to Rahim

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: slow left-arm strikes once more, Kula given leg-before as he pushes forward, could there have been an inside edge, if there wasn't he was gone, Shakib getting the flat delivery to skid on, replays show it would have struck middle

headshotImage.caption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shahadat Hossain 48 (44b 5x4 1x6 60m) SR: 109.09

dismissalComment.html: important strike, Tharanga goes caught behind, to a full away swinging delivery just outside off, Tharanga bent across, tried to run it away but only managed a thick edge to Rahim

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Mashrafe Mortaza 10 (13b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe has been outstanding today, fools Malinga with a slower length ball, he ends up having a slog all around it, off stump is rattled

headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal run out (Jahurul Islam/†Mushfiqur Rahim) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: pull falls short of deep square leg, who lets rid of the ball quickly with a sharp throw to the keeper, Rahim has the bails off before a diving Lakmal can get in

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Thirimanne b Senanayake 59 (57b 9x4 0x6 89m) SR: 103.5

dismissalComment.html: he is gone this time, big wicket, Tamim has cut this shortish ball in the air and point has held on to a sharp catch, tumbling low to his right, still a long way to go for Bangladesh

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Senanayake 56 (46b 7x4 0x6 72m) SR: 121.73

dismissalComment.html: that is close, that is plumb, Shakib is gone, tosses it up, gets it to drift in, lands on middle, does not turn away, skids in with the angle, Shakib is caught on the crease and caught plumb in front, that was taking out leg
he is gone this time, big wicket, Tamim has cut this shortish ball in the air and point has held on to a sharp catch, tumbling low to his right, still a long way to go for Bangladesh

that is close, that is plumb, Shakib is gone, tosses it up, gets it to drift in, lands on middle, does not turn away, skids in with the angle, Shakib is caught on the crease and caught plumb in front, that was taking out leg

he was not looking comfortable with the one coming in, and it has got him on the fourth attempt, Kula gets it to jag back in from a good length, Nazimuddin still wants to force it through the off side, ends up playing a loose stroke from the crease, and inside-edges onto the stumps
massive strike, Kula has bowled Rahim, superb delivery, fullish enough to make him go for the off-drive, and swings in late to go past the bat and hit off

dismissalText.commentary: Nazimuddin b Kulasekara 6 (7b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: he was not looking comfortable with the one coming in, and it has got him on the fourth attempt, Kula gets it to jag back in from a good length, Nazimuddin still wants to force it through the off side, ends up playing a loose stroke from the crease, and inside-edges onto the stumps

dismissalText.commentary: Jahurul Islam c Kapugedera b Lakmal 2 (15b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 13.33

dismissalComment.html: and Jahurul has thrown it away, with Tamim in such supreme touch at the other end, saw Lakmal pitching it short, went for the pull belatedly, and ended up spooning it to squarish midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim b Kulasekara 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 25

headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: that will be it, Bangladesh are through to the final of the Asia Cup, mid on's dive cannot prevent the drive from rushing towards the straight boundary

commentPostTextItems.html: So Bangladesh will meet Pakistan day after in the Asia Cup final. Do join us then, for the moment this is Abhishek Purohit signing off. Have a look at Kanishkaa Balachandran's match report, and log on for stories from Siddarth Ravindran and Mohammad Isam later. And all Bangladesh fans, savour the taste of a well-deserved victory. Bidae nicchhi

Shakib Al Hasan, wearing a tall Bangladesh-flag-coloured cap, is the Man of the Match. Shakib: "The way we expected our crowd to support us, they did exactly that. We have been consistent throught the tournament. Hopefully we will put up a good show in the final. Nazmul bowled really well, he came back after two-three months, it is not easy to do well. Nasir and Mahmudullah played terrific innings, their partnership won us the game. We have found some players who can win matches for us."

Mushfiqur Rahim: "It has been a great tournament for us. Everyone chipped in. Nazmul Hossain did well, that set up the game. We had a stiff target after the rain, but Shakib and Tamim batted well. There are five or six people performing in every game. The final is one of the biggest achievements in our cricketing history. Hopefully we will cross that hurdle. It is a great boost to have the crowd supporting you."

Mahela Jayawardene: "We did not play to our potential, quite a few mistakes, never got into a rhythm, Bangladesh played very well today, they created opportunities from the start. We felt the wicket was much slower, it came on better after the rain. We had our opportunity when they were 135 for 5, but some wayward bowling gave it away. It was a team effort from Bangladesh. Always going to be tough when you play Bangladesh at home."

Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina stands up and applauds, Nasir Hossain screams in delight, Shakib Al Hasan is the first to run out of the dressing room. The team are taking a lap of the Shere Bangla, Bangladesh flags waving proudly all around. They have taken out both the World Cup 2011 finalists and came close to beating former ODI world champions Pakistan. Massive moment for Bangladesh. No one gave them a chance in the lead-up to this tournament. They have made a mess of all predictions. At 135 for 5, the Bangladesh of old would have folded. Not this Bangladesh team though. They did it in their frenetic way at the top, but look no further than Nasir Hossain for one of the coolest young heads going around.
Coming on the back of a gruelling tri-series in Australia, Sri Lanka have looked flat, jaded and out of sorts.
Shenbagaraja: "Victory for bangladesh against any team is no longer an upset!!!"

commentTextItems.html: full toss played out to mid on for a single
inside edges a yorker to Sanga's left, the keeper does superbly to collect it
very low full toss tucked off the pad to fine leg
full delivery, driven to extra cover
bends forward to a low full toss, inside edges it to midwicket
appeal for lbw as the yorker zooms in towards the legs, rolls towards fine leg, it took the bat, as replays show
two more, worked in front of square leg, they come back  by the time deep midwicket gets across

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

commentTextItems.html: easy work off the pad to deep square
he took it from middle and leg, made room and slapped it to sweeper cover
tucked through square leg for a single
forced back to the bowler from the crease

commentPreTextItems.html: prabhakarp: "Habib, we are the world champions (twice), you folks are celebrating reaching asia cup finals, the gap is too much (in case you are thinking that the two teams are comparable), And yes, Bangladesh team is welcome to India."

commentTextItems.html: nudged wide of short fine leg
they keep going for yorker after yorker and Bangladesh continue to deny them, another very full one pushed hard to mid off

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

commentTextItems.html: drives a near-yorker back to the bowler, nothing happening for Sri Lanka, India's hopes nearly gone, Bangladesh wait eagerly
wide called, the short ball gets up, it gets up too much
pushed off the front foot to mid off
yorker arrives just on off, Nasir digs it out to point
close call for Nasir, he is sent back after dabbing a slow one towards backward point, Dilshan lets the throw rip, it misses

commentPreTextItems.html: Habib: "Malinga magic no more, mighty india no more, mediocre bangladesh in the final, time for BCCI to invite BD for a tour."

commentTextItems.html: he really had a crack at that pull as he arched back, straight to deep midwicket though

headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Nazmul Hossain 5 (12b 0x4 0x6 17m) SR: 41.66

dismissalComment.html: he's bowled 'em, what a strike early on for Bangladesh, Mahela is gone with a nothing stroke, length delivery outside off stump, angled in a shade, Mahela leaves a big gap between bat and pad as he ends up wafting tentatively across the line, the ball sneaks through and takes out off

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Nazimuddin b Nazmul Hossain 6 (14b 0x4 0x6 14m) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: oh dear, Sanga has smacked a pitched up delivery straight to extra cover, nothing much in the delivery, it was widish and slanted across Sanga, who got forward and thumped it straight to the fielder, Bangladesh celebrate with glee, Sanga walks off quickly

headshotImage.caption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Nazmul Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan b Nazmul Hossain 19 (22b 3x4 0x6 43m) SR: 86.36

dismissalComment.html: oh boy, Nazmul is all over the Sri Lankans, this time Dilshan has played on, he had become a touch wary after those two big wickets, but that is just not his game, this time he tries to force a length ball through the off side, with no foot movement, the ball was not wide enough, and he ends up getting an inside edge on to the stumps, some start for Bangladesh

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lahiru Thirimanne st †Mushfiqur Rahim b Abdur Razzak 48 (73b 3x4 0x6 89m) SR: 65.75

dismissalComment.html: unfortunate, how unfortunate is that for Thirimanne, he has been stumped off Rahim's pads, he missed the nudge as this one went down the leg side, it all happened so quickly that Rahim was in no position to collect the ball, it rolled onto the stumps off his pad with Thirimanne's momentum having taken him outside the crease, Bangladesh breaking through before the batting Powerplay

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Abdur Razzak player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Shakib Al Hasan b Abdur Razzak
dismissalText.commentary: Chamara Kapugedera c Shakib Al Hasan b Abdur Razzak 62 (92b 4x4 0x6 138m) SR: 67.39

dismissalComment.html: sharp catch from Shakib, Kapu cannot believe it, he had smashed this full delivery inside-out but it carried low to Shakib at extra cover, the former captain goes low to hold on

headshotImage.caption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Farveez Maharoof player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan
dismissalText.commentary: Farveez Maharoof c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shakib Al Hasan 3 (3b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 100

dismissalComment.html: Shakib strikes, Maharoof going for the cut to a tossed up ball that straightened and skidded, gets an edge through to Rahim

dismissalText.commentary: Nuwan Kulasekara lbw b Shakib Al Hasan 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: slow left-arm strikes once more, Kula given leg-before as he pushes forward, could there have been an inside edge, if there wasn't he was gone, Shakib getting the flat delivery to skid on, replays show it would have struck middle

headshotImage.caption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Shahadat Hossain player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c †Mushfiqur Rahim b Shahadat Hossain 48 (44b 5x4 1x6 60m) SR: 109.09

dismissalComment.html: important strike, Tharanga goes caught behind, to a full away swinging delivery just outside off, Tharanga bent across, tried to run it away but only managed a thick edge to Rahim

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Mashrafe Mortaza 10 (13b 1x4 0x6 16m) SR: 76.92

dismissalComment.html: Mashrafe has been outstanding today, fools Malinga with a slower length ball, he ends up having a slog all around it, off stump is rattled

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Suranga Lakmal run out (Jahurul Islam/†Mushfiqur Rahim) 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: pull falls short of deep square leg, who lets rid of the ball quickly with a sharp throw to the keeper, Rahim has the bails off before a diving Lakmal can get in

dismissalText.commentary: Tamim Iqbal c Thirimanne b Senanayake 59 (57b 9x4 0x6 89m) SR: 103.5

dismissalComment.html: he is gone this time, big wicket, Tamim has cut this shortish ball in the air and point has held on to a sharp catch, tumbling low to his right, still a long way to go for Bangladesh

dismissalText.commentary: Nazimuddin b Kulasekara 6 (7b 1x4 0x6 6m) SR: 85.71

dismissalComment.html: he was not looking comfortable with the one coming in, and it has got him on the fourth attempt, Kula gets it to jag back in from a good length, Nazimuddin still wants to force it through the off side, ends up playing a loose stroke from the crease, and inside-edges onto the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jahurul Islam player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Suranga Lakmal, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Chamara Kapugedera player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Jahurul Islam c Kapugedera b Lakmal 2 (15b 0x4 0x6 24m) SR: 13.33

dismissalComment.html: and Jahurul has thrown it away, with Tamim in such supreme touch at the other end, saw Lakmal pitching it short, went for the pull belatedly, and ended up spooning it to squarish midwicket

dismissalText.commentary: Mushfiqur Rahim b Kulasekara 1 (4b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: massive strike, Kula has bowled Rahim, superb delivery, fullish enough to make him go for the off-drive, and swings in late to go past the bat and hit off

dismissalText.commentary: Shakib Al Hasan lbw b Senanayake 56 (46b 7x4 0x6 72m) SR: 121.73

dismissalComment.html: that is close, that is plumb, Shakib is gone, tosses it up, gets it to drift in, lands on middle, does not turn away, skids in with the angle, Shakib is caught on the crease and caught plumb in front, that was taking out leg

dismissalText.commentary: Nasir Hossain not out 36 (61b 3x4 0x6 86m) SR: 59.01
Mahmudullah not out 32 (33b 3x4 0x6 65m) SR: 96.96

stories.title: Bangladesh desperate for slump to end
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh desperate for slump to end
stories.summary: The outcome of this match will have no bearing on who contests the Asia Cup final, and so Sri Lanka will use it to fine-tune their preparation for the summit clash against Pakistan

stories.title: Time for Bangladesh to get used to crunch games
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur

stories.summary: How does a team that has for years played with low expectations approach a must-win game? Do they hide behind their underdog status, or prove they can deal with pressure?

stories.title: Bangladesh relying on team effort, not individuals
stories.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur
stories.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur: Bangladesh relying on team effort, not individuals
stories.summary: The hosts' performances in this Asia Cup have been built on many players contributing rather than solo efforts. They will hope for another all-round showing as they attempt to reach just their second tournament final

series.name: Asia Cup
series.description: Bangladesh, India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka in Bangladesh

seriesStandings.notes:
Preliminary Matches Win, with bonus point - 5
Win, without bonus point - 4
Tie or No Result - 2
Loss - 0 In the event of teams finishing on equal points, the right to play in the final match or series will be determined as follows:
  • The team with the most number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the most number of wins over the other team(s) who are equal on points and have the same number of wins
  • If still equal, the team with the highest number of bonus points
  • If still equal, the team with the highest net run rate
In a match declared as no result, run rate is not applicable. Net Run Rate A team's net run rate is calculated by deducting from the average runs per over scored by that team throughout the competition, the average runs per over scored against that team throughout the competition. In the event of a team being all out in less than its full quota of overs, the calculation of its net run rate shall be based on the full quota of overs to which it would have been entitled and not on the number of overs in which the team was dismissed. Only those matches where results are achieved will count for the purpose of net run rate calculations. Where a match is abandoned, but a result is achieved under Duckworth/Lewis, for net run rate purposes Team 1 will be accredited with Team 2's Par Score on abandonment off the same number of overs faced by Team 2. Where a match is concluded but with Duckworth/Lewis having been applied at an earlier point in the match, Team 1 will be accredited with 1 run less than the final Target Score for Team 2 off the total number of overs allocated to Team 2 to reach the target. Bonus Points The team that achieves a run rate of 1.25 times that of the opposition shall be awarded one bonus point. A team's run rate will be calculated by reference to the runs scored in an innings divided by the number of overs faced.

recentReportStory.title: Team effort takes Bangladesh to historic final
recentReportStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur
recentReportStory.seoTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup: Team effort takes Bangladesh to historic final
recentReportStory.summary: Bangladesh made it to the final of the Asia Cup, defying pre-tournament expectations with consecutive victories against their more fancied neighbours

image.caption: Tamim Iqbal reaches his third consecutive ODI half-century
image.longCaption: Tamim Iqbal reaches his third consecutive ODI half-century, Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur, March 20, 2012

recentReportStory.credit: Kanishkaa Balachandran is a senior sub-editor at ESPNcricinfo

recentPreviewStory.title: Bangladesh desperate for slump to end
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur
recentPreviewStory.seoTitle: Bangladesh desperate for slump to end
recentPreviewStory.summary: The outcome of this match will have no bearing on who contests the Asia Cup final, and so Sri Lanka will use it to fine-tune their preparation for the summit clash against Pakistan

image.caption: Ajantha Mendis gives the ball a good rip
image.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis gives the ball a good rip, India v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Fatullah, February 28, 2014

recentPreviewStory.credit: Mohammad Isam is ESPNcricinfo's Bangladesh correspondent. He tweets here

video.title: Agarkar: SL need batsmen back in form
video.subTitle: Bangladesh v Sri Lanka, Asia Cup, Mirpur
video.seoTitle: Agarkar: SL need batsmen back in form
video.summary: Ajit Agarkar says the dead rubber against Bangladesh is an opportunity for Sri Lanka's batsmen to find form before the Asia Cup final
